entry.title: ACLU of ColoradoWayne Williams is with Lynn Bartels and 20 others.Some folks have asked me about Colorado's voting systems. After an...
entry.content:
ACLU of ColoradoWayne Williams is with Lynn Bartels and 20 others.

Some folks have asked me about Colorado's voting systems. After an exhaustive administrative, legislative, and legal review, many Colorado counties began using... the federally certified Dominion Voting System in 2016. Since its adoption, Dominion machines have been tested in 62 Colorado counties at least 807 times. They have passed every test.

First, each county in each election uses a bipartisan board to test the voting system prior to using it -- that's a total of 455 pre-election Logic and Accuracy Tests in nine elections.

Second, in 2017 Colorado began conducting a Risk Limiting Audit after each election. In an RLA, bipartisan teams of judges in each county compare the cast vote record from the Dominion scanners to randomly selected paper ballots (with more actual ballots compared when the race is close). In the six elections since Colorado began RLAs, the Dominion Voting System has passed 352 times. (The other systems used in Colorado also have passed.) And Colorado is in the midst of conducting an RLA for the 2020 general election as well.

So, while I can't speak for the practices of every state (some of whom don't have the procedural protections and audits we do in Colorado), I can state that in Colorado the voting systems we use accurately record the votes of Coloradans -- and we've proved it 807 times.

See MoreDominion Voting Systems Corp., a little-known voting-machine supplier that has come under criticism from President Trump, was a linchpin in the 2020 election that federal and state officials praise as being free from tampering.

wsj.com

Voting Machine Supplier Criticized by Trump in Spotlight on Election Integrity

Dominion Voting Systems Corp., a little-known voting-machine supplier that has come under criticism from President Trump, was a linchpin in the 2020 election that federal and state officials praise as being free from tampering.Dominion Voting Systems Corp., a little-known voting-machine supplier that has come under criticism from President Trump, was a linchpin in the 2020 election that federal and state officials praise as being free from tampering.

entry.title: Ronald Johnson is a 62-year-old grandfather, at high risk for...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Ronald Johnson is a 62-year-old grandfather, at high risk for serious complications from COVID-19. He changed his life after being convicted of non-violent offenses related to substance abuse. He should be safely home with family, not facing a death sentence.

Watch his story here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUMtgiiOxxA#action=share

Ronald Johnson is pre-diabetic, suffers from asthma and high blood pressure, and regularly uses an inhaler to breathe. His age and respiratory ailments put h...

entry.title: Anthony Martinez is a prime example of someone who should be...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Anthony Martinez is a prime example of someone who should be safely released. An 84-year-old grandfather, he uses a wheelchair and suffers from renal failure and dementia. Releasing him to live with family poses no threat to public safety but keeping him needlessly incarcerated does.

Watch his story here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g_9Or0Ap9oc

Anthony Martinez is an 84-year-old grandfather suffering from renal failure, as well as other serious medical conditions including dementia. He is currently ...

entry.title: BREAKING: Today we resolved our lawsuit against the DOC and...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

BREAKING: Today we resolved our lawsuit against the DOC and amended our complaint against the Governor. As the complaint states, unless the Governor authorizes reducing the number of people in Colorado’s prisons “outbreaks will continue, and people will die.”

November 13, 2020 DENVER – With two court filings today, ACLU of Colorado announced a resolution with the Colorado Department of Corrections (DOC) of last May’s class action lawsuit alleging failure to protect medically vulnerable people in prison from COVID-19. … Continue reading →

aclu-co.org

ACLU and DOC Resolve Class Action COVID-19 Lawsuit, While Case Against Governor Continues | ACLU of Colorado

November 13, 2020 DENVER – With two court filings today, ACLU of Colorado announced a resolution with the Colorado Department of Corrections (DOC) of last May’s class action lawsuit alleging failure to protect medically vulnerable people in prison from COVID-19. … Continue reading →November 13, 2020 DENVER – With two court filings today, ACLU of Colorado announced a resolution with the Colorado Department of Corrections (DOC) of last May’s class action lawsuit alleging failure to protect medically vulnerable people in prison from COVID-19. … Continue reading →

entry.title: Despite the severe risk the pandemic poses in jails and prisons,...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Despite the severe risk the pandemic poses in jails and prisons, El Paso County Jail didn't begin distributing masks to people in jail until as late as November 1st. As a likely consequence of this negligence, 859 people being held at El Paso County Jail and 66 staffers tested positive for COVID-19 earlier this week. The county directly disobeyed a federal court order to protect people during the pandemic.

Read more: https://www.thedenverchannel.com/…/colorado-springs-mother-…

A Colorado Springs mother is asking for answers after her son and hundreds of other prisoners in the El Paso County jail as well as dozens of staffers have tested positive for COVID-19.

thedenverchannel.com

Colorado Springs mother asking for answers as hundreds of inmates test positive for coronavirus

A Colorado Springs mother is asking for answers after her son and hundreds of other prisoners in the El Paso County jail as well as dozens of staffers have tested positive for COVID-19.A Colorado Springs mother is asking for answers after her son and hundreds of other prisoners in the El Paso County jail as well as dozens of staffers have tested positive for COVID-19.

entry.title: "This is like Sheriff Elder hanging a sign on the jail...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

"This is like Sheriff Elder hanging a sign on the jail saying, ‘Please sue me,'” said Mark Silverstein, legal director of the ACLU of Colorado. “And I imagine someone will accept that invitation.”

The more than 1,200 inmates inside the El Paso County jail on any given day were not provided masks until last week, when the jail became the site of Colorado’s second-largest coronavirus out…

El Paso County jail inmates weren’t given masks prior to one of Colorado’s largest COVID-19 outbreaks

entry.title: Yesterday Denver City Council approved a $500,000 budget for the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Yesterday Denver City Council approved a $500,000 budget for the Denver Immigrant Legal Services Fund — a program that helps provide immigration attorney services to those facing deportation and separation from their families. Thank you, Denver City Council.

Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC

🎉🎉🎉
Having access to an immigration attorney is life changing for Denver families and all the more critical during this economic crisis and the increased COVID-19 outbreaks that the Aurora GEO immigration detention facility.

entry.title: Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must stop the spread of risk assessment tools – where a computer tries to predict your behavior – and decides whether or not you stay in jail. These tools make too many mistakes. Read more: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

entry.title: Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights was live.

***seguido por español***
#COVID19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned, with outbreaks in more than two dozen carceral setting in Colorado right now. We ...know #DetentionIsDeadly and the only safe course of action for people in cages, the workers at those facilities and the #publichealth is to #FreeThemAll.
*** #COVID19 representa una amenaza a toda nuestra gente encarcelada. Colorado se encuentra con brotes en mas de dos docenas en lugares carcelarios ahora mismo. Sabemos que la detención es mortal y que el único curso de acción seguro, tanto para las personas en jaulas, los trabajadores en estos lugares y la #saludpublica es liberarlos a todos.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s decision to return to business as usual and the GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe. Experts like Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes are calling for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Tonight, we will hear from loved ones of those jailed, impacted individuals and the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado about how your donations can free our people!
***La decisión de la migra de regresar a operativos “normales” conjunto con como GEO maneja su centro de detención, ponen en peligro la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. Expertos como Dr. Carlos Paredes están clamando por una liberación humanitaria de todas las personas encarceladas. ¡Esta noche escucharemos de los seres queridos de la gente aprisionada, de personas detenidas y del Fondo de Liberación de Inmigrantes en Colorado sobre como sus donativos pueden rescatar a nuestra gente!

This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People’s Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.
****Este evento es patrocinado por el Comité de Servicio de los Amigos Americanos en Colorado, Colorado People’s Alliance, Colorado Freedom Fund Y TAMBIEN el Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

See More

entry.title: Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing and criminal legal data steeped in structural racism. Cloaking a broken system behind an aura of technology and objectivity doesn’t make it right. If we want a more just system we must do better than relying on pretrial RATS.
https://bit.ly/3n8e9KC

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

boulderweekly.com

Analyzing the risk - Boulder Weekly

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. entry.title: It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent person of their pretrial liberty based on a concern they might get a traffic ticket or fail to show up in court. Yet that's what happens in CO every day when judges use risk assessment tools. https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us tonight at 6 p.m. for a socially-distanced caravan at the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora. During a deadly pandemic, GEO cannot be trusted to protect the lives of our friends and family. We must demand that people are safely released:

WHEN: Tonight at 6 p.m.
WHERE: 3130 Oakland St.
WHAT: We will caravan to the Denver Women’s Correctional Facility and Denver County Jail and back while listening to advocates and testimony via Facebook Live.
